intro: Cyrtandropsis, commonly known as the African daisy or yellow daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other flowering plants. The plants typically have showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Cyrtandropsis species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They are valued for their ornamental beauty and are sometimes cultivated in gardens for their vibrant floral displays.
